title: Think Rumali Rotis Are The Biggest? This Man Made A Pashtoon Roti The Size Of A Shawl!

Think Rumali Rotis Are The Biggest? This Man Made A Pashtoon Roti The Size Of A Shawl!

Think Rumali Rotis Are The Biggest? This Man Made A Pashtoon Roti The Size Of A Shawl!

Just like India, Rotis are a staple in Afghanistan, but when it comes to Rumali Roti, they have a version which is out of this world.

Making a perfect round roti is easier said than done. It takes practice and patience and if you thought making Rumali Roti is out of your league, check out these Pashtooni men making rotis the size of a shawl.

We have all heard of ‘roomali’ roti. Ever heard of a ‘chadar’ roti. Can feed the entire family and more! pic.twitter.com/Qtu7iBRm6D — Harsh Goenka (@hvgoenka) October 25, 2019

You need to see it to believe it. A video posted by Harsh Goenka shows a man preparing this special roti also called is called postha (singular) or posthi (plural) in local Pashto language.

Only one bread maker with only one assistant prepares bread for several hundreds people for whole of the gathering participating in the marriage ceremony.

The man first kneads the dough and twirls it around with ease to make a massive thin sheet of roti and tosses it onto an upside down wok.

Mostly made during social gathering like weddings, these rotis are popular among tribes residing near the Pakistan-Afghanistan border.
